meanings.definition: A taxonomic group, especially one of the rank of genus or species.
meanings.sent1: In the forest, the biologist identified different taxa of plants.
meanings.sent2: The textbook explained how to classify living organisms into various taxa.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome decided to organize the flowers based on their taxa.
meanings.sent4: The chef separated the ingredients into distinct taxa like different spices in a recipe.
meanings.sent5: The colorful butterflies belonged to the same taxa, making them easy to group together.

meanings.definition: A taxonomic category above the level of species and below the level of family.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper learned about the different taxa of animals in the wildlife park.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the relationships between taxa to understand biodiversity.
meanings.sent3: The students created a game where they had to guess the taxa of various animals.
meanings.sent4: The library organized books into different taxa based on their genres.
meanings.sent5: The museum exhibit displayed fossils from various taxa, showcasing evolution over time.
